description: Trump's pardons for white-collar criminals and January 6 defendants eliminated $1.3 billion in court-ordered restitution, impacting victims and taxpayers.
notes: Comprehensive analysis shows systemic abuse of presidential pardon power to benefit white-collar criminals.

Trump white-collar criminal pardons cost public $1bn, says ex-DoJ official

summary: A House Judiciary Committee review revealed that Trump's pardons eliminated $1.3 billion in restitution from white-collar criminals and January 6 defendants. Notable cases include Todd Chrisley's $17.7 million tax fraud pardon, Carlos Watson's $36.7 million investor fraud clemency, and Lawrence Duran's $87 million Medicare fraud pardon. Only 15% of $3 million in Capitol riot damages had been recovered before these pardons.
title: Trump Pardons Eliminate $1.3 Billion in Restitution, Costing Victims and Taxpayers
